entry.title: DFDL WG - document #249: binaryDecimalVirtualPoint property
entry.content:
• Status changed from submitted to accepted
  • % Done changed from 0 to 100

Mis-spellings of the property name in the various places in the spec will be corrected.
- 13.7.1.1: dfdl:binaryVirtualDecimalPoint
- 22.2.1: dfdl:decimalVirtualPoint (x2 in the "calendar" section)

DFDL WG confirmed that, in the absence of binary number rounding properties, if the binaryDecimalVirtualPoint value is not sufficient to remove the decimal point from the infoset value when unparsing, then it is a processing error.

This is a specific case of excess precision as already stated in spec 13.7.1. Technically, precision is the number of digits, and trailing zeros are significant even after a decimal point. Therefore it is a processing error if the infoset contains decimal value 123.990 and the element has BDVP 2. While this can be serialized to an integer, the original decimal has excess precision. Similarly it is a processing error if the infoset contains decimal value of 12300.0 and the element has BDVP -2.
